Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a band-cup; glaze unevenly fired; interior glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of woman hastening to right between large confronted cocks; left bird has added red on wing and added white band on breast; woman has red dress with white dots on hem and white feet; second bird has red on body and tail, white band on breast and row of white dots on tail; at right, part of tail with red patch and white dots of a further bird, to right; below, glazed band ; reserved band at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0466) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
